no matter how many times i‚Äôve watched this film, it never fails to make me cry (and inis at the same time!) > : )when i first watched this film, i was happy that they got back together in the end. i used to be a sucker for second chance tropes, so i was really hoping for them to be with each other again. but after rewatching it with all the knowledge i have today, i‚Äôve had a lot of realizations about this film.primo‚Äôs actions to win her back (all the singing of umuwi ka na baby and bare minimum shits) & the letter he wrote do not validate every single thing that he made george feel. not all relationships deserve a comeback. no man is ever worth sacrificing your dream for. NO MATTER HOW MUCH YOU LOVE THEM. of course at first, your heart will ache with their absence. there will still be times that it will still hurt, but i swear, it gets better! it is healthier and happier to grow alone instead of staying yourself in a relationship that drains you.love is also about acceptance and letting go. choosing yourself over staying with someone who drags you down is the best form of love that you can give yourself !# shungekz mo talaga, jo !!!!!!

‚Äòisang beses lang ako nagtanong kung kaya ko pa ba. isang beses lang ako nagkaroon ng lakas ng loob para sabihin kung ano talaga yung nararamdaman ko, na nasasaktan nako, na nauubos nako. isang beses sa napakaraming beses na pwede akong sumuko pero di ko ginawa. pero isang beses lang din pala yung kailangan mo para sumuko, para umalis at hindi na bumalik. i needed you to fight for us that night because i was so tired fighting alone. yung kahit na sabihing kong umalis ka di ka aalis kasi kilala mo ko e. alam mo na nasabi ko lang yun kasi pagod ako pero mahal kita.‚Äô‚Äòmahal din naman kita e. mahal parin naman kita‚Äô ‚Äòpero isang beses lang ako napagod iniwan mo na ako‚Äô ‚Äòhow could you give up so easily? how did you not find a reason to stay‚Äô ‚Äòhinding hindi nako papayag na ubusin mo ako ulet. pagtigil ng ulan, paguwi ko, i want you gone. i will just get in touch with you kapag may kailangan ipasign kapag nabenta na yung bahay.‚Äô‚Äôalam ko na pagtila ng ulan dapat wala nako dito pero pwede bang huwag muna. i want to stay hanggang maibenta natin itong bahay.‚Äôüéß‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π‚ú®Decode~Sabrina Carpenter‚Äòyou‚Äôre good at the falling not the staying there. you‚Äôre good at the giving too much then getting scared. you‚Äôre good at impersonating someone who cares and you had me for a minute there. but now I wonder why I let your confusion keep me up at night. i'm so tired. re-read every single undertone and I overanalyzed it, front, back, and beside it where else can we go? there's nothing left here to decode. done lookin' for signs in the gaps and the silence. It's just getting old, there's nothing left here to decode‚Äô‚Äòintay lang. pasensya. until the sun rises again because it always does and when it does, at andyan ka parin nakabukas ka, you‚Äôre in for a lot of surprises. i may not have a reason to stay but i found a reason to come back.‚Äômy soul felt their testimony; i hope our soul would realign again and find reasons to forgive ourselves and each other when we‚Äôre all healed someday.if that someday never happens, i‚Äôm still grateful to have lived & learned through that imperfectly beautiful memory from that seasonü´ÇüéÜ‚Äòblessed, blind, & broken‚Äô

Star Cinema have to stop producing repetitive and mediocre storyline for a romantic-drama/comedy film while using famous love teams to extract money from the audience especially to avid Kathniel fans. first, there are so many side stories such as the medical problem and the daddy issue which i find it unnecessary. i also want to point out the longingness of Darren to his father does not break the social construct of a traditional family and his acting makes it even annoying. second, the part where they go abroad seems forced, just to say that the movie is set in Amsterdam. it is irrelevant and a waste of production's money especially they can use provincial places in our country. third, the friends of Kathryn and Daniel are trying hard to be funny and have no significance to the character development of the protagonists even if Juan Miguel's role makes sense. fourth, the dialogues are too cheesy and have so many "hugot lines". fifth, the moral story of this film only taught audiences to be hopless romantic and to endure toxicity in order to save the relationship. the only breakthrough somehow is the absence of third party in the relationship. as well, Kathryn is too good as an actress to play another fragile female character.P.S.pangalawang beses ko na itong napanood at ganun pa rin, inis na inis pa rin talaga sa pekikulang ito. hindi na ulit ako mag-aaksaya ng dalawang oras para dito. mas pipiliin ko na lang ulit panoorin ang SDTG o HLG.

Since the breakup of power couple Kathryn Bernardo and Daniel Padilla, it seems like the best thing to do is to have a bittersweet marathon of all their films together. Although the teen romance genre is not typically not my cup of tea, the wife and I was able to watch at least one Kathniel film - which turned out to be their last - The Hows of Us (2018). Directed by the go-to filmmaker when it comes to romantic drama blockbusters, Cathy Garcia-Molina crafted something truly special that would resonate more to the love team's followers five years later.The film revolves around the central characters, George (Kathryn Bernardo) and Primo (Daniel Padilla), a couple whose relationship undergoes a tumultuous journey. The narrative ingeniously navigates through the highs and lows of their love story, exploring themes of commitment, dreams, and the inevitable challenges that life throws at them. The storytelling is compelling, keeping the audience engaged with a mix of heartwarming moments and gut-wrenching conflicts.By letting Bernardo and Padilla portray layered and maturing characters, this project breaks the conventional boundaries of the love team which became widely popular through their numerous rom-com TV serials. The commitment of the two young actors make this work as the story revolves around their truly relatable character arcs. Although the supporting cast could also use deeper exploration, the couple's natural chemistry is the beating heart of this film.It may have leaned more towards traditional romantic comedy/drama elements, but the film's success lies in its passionate execution, especially in terms of narrative exploration and character depth. The actors' real-life love story may have ended, but this film shall remain as a highlight of PH cinema.4.0 OUT OF 5‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠êüìÉSTORY - 0.8üé•EXECUTION - 0.8üë•CHARACTERIZATION - 0.8üçøENTERTAINMENT VALUE - 0.8‚ú®LASTING IMPACT - 0.8

Man, this Filipino movie was the boss for a whole year, raking in the moolah like crazy. And you know what? Totally deserved it. Firstly, Kathryn Bernardo ditched the teen idol tag and went full-blown actress ‚Äì nailed it! There's this scene that screams dramatic superstar. Secondly, it's got this crazy formula that somehow clicks. Imagine all genres crashing like a traffic jam, but hey, it works like magic. Drama, comedy, romance ‚Äì it's a whole package. Thirdly, it's like a crash course in Filipino values ‚Äì family vibes, chasing dreams, and growing old with your ride-or-die. Can't get more Filipino than this. And let's not forget the killer screenplay and the jaw-dropping scenes of Amsterdam. Pure awesomeness!

*incoming word vomit, i will not reread this to check it the things i say make sense fjsdhfd*I watched this with a loud as-it-happens commentary on the decisions the characters make and I find myself acting like how people usually would advice their friends when they're with a /useless/ partner. I'd say "LEAVE HIM!" or "He isn't worth it!!!" or "There are other fish in the sea!!! Better fish!!"But I found myself silently relating a bit too much to Primo as I watched. I know how comforting it is that you know that there's someone rooting for you in what you feel are your darkest times. The only difference is that I live alone, therefore there was no one to see me when my 'functional' mask is off. In a way, it's good to not reveal that to anyone. But at the same, it may have been helpful to have someone like Jo around. (anyway, therapy helps!! you dont need a jowa to save you from yourself HAHA)My favorite part was when Jo opened up about how she felt about their breakup. The choice the scriptwriters made to have Jo angry at the fact that Primo left, rather than the fact that we was a piece of shit on the days leading to their breakup made it clear that she really was rooting for him. That her love for Primo was rooted in something deeper than the idea of what he could offer her. She was simply disappointed that he gave up on what they had when she started to break down as well. I definitely feel like their breakup was necessary. At that point, Jo's hope was the singular thread keeping that relationship intact, and hope can only take so much. So when it wasn't strong, the relationship had to unravel. And it was good that they both grew despite being apart.Did she have to go back to Primo? I don't know. If she didn't, i think it'll go to a "Past Lives" type of scenario when they meet each other again in the far far future, except with more contempt.On the subject of passion vs. practicality. I wish I knew the answer. I always always want people to choose passion. But I can't relate because I don't have passion. I simply have a drive to survive. So I go for practicality. But if I had passion like Primo, I understand why he acted the way he did. I always imagine that it must be nice to want something so strongly.Overall, I liked this movie. That red biochem book was one sturdy mf.

Nah man, sometimes toxicity can be too much. The movie tries to be genuine and tell a mature story not of first love, but trying to work through it, a story not often told. Primo and George want to be together but life and conflicting wants and personalities get in the way and people find themselves with the choice of staying or leaving; if the sacrifices were worth it. There‚Äôs a good movie here but its too cluttered with tropes and formula that it falls back to convention when it doesn‚Äôt have an idea for a scene.

Dyan ka lang. Dyan ka lang. Putek, yan ka nanaman eh! Palibhasa kasi alam na alam mo pano ako kunin eh. Isang ngiti, isang kanta, isang akap, isang sorry, wala umiikot na ulit yung mundo ko. Tangina, Primo. Matalino akong tao eh pero pagdating sayo ewan ko natatanga ako. Ano nanaman yung kapalit kapag binalikan nanaman kita? Titigil nanaman yung mundo ko para sayo? Ilang taon nanaman ng buhay ko yung sasayangin ko? Tangina alam mo ba si Miko? Ayun, magiging doctor na. Si Jessica? Happily married. Ako? Eto, sinusubukan pa rin bumangon para bawiin yung lahat nang nawala sakin nung iniwan mo ako. Jorge, I'm sorry. And what makes that sorry different from all your other sorries before? Halos pitong taon ng buhay ko binigay ko sayo, Primo. At sa pitong taon na 'yun, isang beses lang ako nagsabing pagod na ako. Isang beses lang ako nagtanong kung kaya ko pa ba.
